section.section: Unless a certificate is renewed for a 3-year term as provided in this section, the certification expires on the date set by the State Fire Marshal.
The State Fire Marshal may determine that certificates issued under this subtitle shall expire on a staggered basis.

text.section:
A certified nongovernmental electrical inspector may renew the certification for a 3-year term if the certificate holder:
otherwise is entitled to be certified; and
submits to the State Fire Marshal:
a renewal application on the form the State Fire Marshal provides;
a renewal fee of $50; and
satisfactory evidence of compliance with any other requirements under this section for renewal of certification.
Certificate holders who fail to renew within 90 days from the date of expiration shall be required to submit an initial application and successfully pass the written examination.
The State Fire Marshal shall renew the certification of each applicant who meets the requirements of this section.
